intro: Ceodes taitensis, commonly known as the Taiti ceodes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
